title: Should Rito give us an increased chance of getting keys after games and better hextech loot?
body:
Whenever I play a game of normals and ranked, I always want to get key fragments and hextech chests. whenever I get 3 key fragments it feels like an accomplishment, but I always question if it was worth it. Sometimes it takes 3-4 games to get 1 key, and sometimes it even takes 9-10 games. Whenever i get a key and a chest i always go straight to hextech crafting to see what i get. Most of the time i get champion shards that I think wasn't worth the games i played to get it. Whenever i get skin shards you still need essences to actually get the skin. Sometimes those shards that you got after so many games just ends up being rerolled. 

So should Rito increase the chance of getting key fragments after games and get better hextech loot? Please Vote below.

replies.body: Considering there was **no chance** to get Champs or Skins for free before the Hextech Crafting system existed I'm inclined to say we're lucky to have any chance at all. Sure, a lot of luck is involved and you might get nothing you want but there's also a chance you might end up surprised. I know I've experienced both sides of it and I'm sure everyone does eventually. I mean sure, Rito could be more generous and tune the numbers but I guess I'm just happy it exists at all since I wouldn't' have managed to snag some cool things so far.
I haven't gotten a key shard in like 72 games. Lol.

If they gave better loot then the criteria for getting keys and chests should be increased.
Personally I'm not a big fan of hextech crafting, especially as part of the level 6 and 7 mastery system.
